lines.text: I never did get to know exactly what she'd done that was so wrong.
Old Ben was a friend of mine Sam, and she killed him.
It was his own fault. He was ninety-two. I warned him not to marry her!
This is my squaw, Kitikata. I bought her for two buffalo skins.
How.
Never mind how, where!

[addressing the Indian chief]
How! Me-um heap big paleface chief from-um Stodge City. Me-um salute-um big chief. Me-um want-um pow-wow.

[speaking perfect English]
I say, you do talk funny. You must be foreigners.

[admiring his gun]
My, but you got a big one!
I'm from Texas, ma'am. We all got big ones down there.

[the opening scene after he shoots the three men]
I wonder what they wanted?
What's the matter? What have I done wrong?
You just killed three men, mister.
I know that, but what have I done wrong?
It's another telegram from Stodge City, sir. Judge Burke. He's the mayor there, you know.
Burke? Oh yeah, I remember him in law school. He's a bum.
I didn't know you studied at law school, sir.
I didn't. I was the janitor.
Send him a Marshall. Anything for peace.
That's just the trouble, sir. We haven't any available.
Nobody? What about that big head who's always hanging around here looking for work? What's his name? Dillon. What's he doing?
Six months.
I once talked peace with a Sioux, but you can't trust them. One moment it was peace on, the next it was peace off.

[referring to Annie Oakley]
But Johnny, she's no good! Take it from me, she's after something.
Take it from me, if you get out of the way she's gonna get it!
But Johnny, have you forgotten? I'm your little ding dong!
I hate to have to say it, but your ding has lost its dong!
